title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 11 §§ 81-2.3 - Preliminary information report for the investment in or acquisition of an institution
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 11 §§ 81-2.3 - Preliminary information report for the investment in or acquisition of an institution

State Regulations

Every domestic life insurer and every domestic retirement system subject to article 46 of the Insurance Law which, after the effective date of this Subpart: (a) invests in or acquires, directly or indirectly, 10 percent or more of the voting securities of any institution, or subsequently invests in or acquires additional increments of 10 percent of more of the voting securities of such institution; or
(b) acquires, directly or indirectly, control of any institution shall file a preliminary information report on form PIR (see Appendix 22, infra) with the superintendent within 30 days of such investment or acquisition. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 11
§§
81-2.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
